chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Donovan Vanwormer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

**Restitution in the amount of $75 ordered by the Court in accordance with the Stipulation and Order filed by the parties on March 4, 2016.***    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact whatsoever with C.J.S., K. Sina and/or S. Vetrone.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.    Defendant to comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

records.addlTxt: Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 10/12/2016 Re: Jail Transfer - Court does not object to transfer of SEH to another jurisdiction.
Overpayment returned to DOC - Ck No 011156
for Restitution in the amount of $75.00 to be paid to S. Vetrone
Restitution hearing at 03-09-2016 02:30 pm

Case Called @ 2:18 PM: Defendant Mitchell Donovan Vanwormer in court with attorney Paul F.X. Schwartz.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing.  Agreement will call for amendments to each count.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court will accepts State's motion to amend Ct 1 of INFO to Op w/o Owner's Consent (to include affirmative offense of abandonment) contrary to s. 943.23(3m)  Plea:  NC  Court also accepts State's motion to amend as to Ct 2 of INFO to Misd Theft contary to s. 943.20(1)(a) -  Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC as to each count.  Court appreciates amendment of Ct 1 - obviates any factual basis concern and is a benefit for Def.  Argument by ADA as to expungement request - would object to same.  Argument by Atty Schwartz as to expungement.  Statement by Def: Yes apologizes to everyone involved.  The Court:   Will accept resolution - appropriate resolution.  Ct 1:  6 mos WCJ - I/S as to each count - concurrent terms.  Huber, GT and 2 days TS credit if revoked.  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions of Supervision: Rest TBD at further hearing; No Contact with K. Sina; CJS and or S. Vetrone, Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court; any other terms as deemed appropriate by supervising agent.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  As to expungement request:  Def has rec'd benefit of no felony conviction - no cond'l time being imposed.  Request for expungement denied - accountability required.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case Called @ 1:14 PM: Defendant Mitchell Donovan Vanwormer in court, in custody, appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def may possibly be hiring his own counsel.  Court will proceed with the understanding that own counsel will be retained.  DA argues as to bond request - $2500 Signature Bond w/no contact provisions being requested.  No statement as to bond offered by Def.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
